Class BankAccount

  • java.lang.Object
    • BankAccount

  • public class BankAccount
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a bank account. It holds the name of the owner, the current balance and a list of transactions that were performed on this bank account.
    Author:
    123456ab Paul Bouman

      This constructor stores the name of the owner and the initial balance of the bank account.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BankAccount

        public BankAccount(java.lang.String ownerName,
                   int initialBalance)
        This constructor stores the name of the owner and the initial balance of the bank account. By default, the list of transactions associated with the bank account is empty.
        Parameters:
        ownerName - the name of the owner of the new bank account
        initialBalance - the initial balance of the new bank account

    • Method Detail

      • computeBalanceAfterInterest

        public double computeBalanceAfterInterest(int periods,
                                          double rate)
                                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Computes the balance after applying a given interest rate for a number of periods.

        It is assumed that interest is paid at the end of each period, and that the interest is compounded.

        The formula used for this is: balance × (1 + rate)periods

        Example: a bank account with a balance of 100 will become 110.25 after applying an interest of 0.05 for two periods.

        Parameters:
        periods - the number of periods in which interest should be applied
        rate - the interest rate applied in every period
        Returns:
        the balanced after the interest is applied for the number of periods to the current balance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if periods is smaller than zero

      • getBalance

        public int getBalance()
        Provides the current balance of this bank account. The current balance is the initial balance provided when the object was created adjusted by succesful transactions involving this bank account.
        Returns:
        the current balance of the bank account

      • getOwner

        public java.lang.String getOwner()
        Provides the owner associated with this bank account, that was provided during the creation of this bank account object.
        Returns:
        the name of the owner of this bank account

      • getTransactions

        public java.util.List<Transaction> getTransactions()
        Provides the list of transactions that involve this bank account. Note that this list cannot be modified.
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable list of transactions involving this bank account.

      • withdrawMoney

        public void withdrawMoney(int amount)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Performs the withdraw money transaction on this bank account. The transaction is only performed if there is sufficient balance on the account.
        Parameters:
        amount - the amount of money to withdraw from the bank account
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the amount exceeds the current balance of the account
